      • getJobLinks

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getJobLinks()
        Description copied from interface: IScheduler
        This method will be called after onScheduler It is responsible to return links to topology's customized ui pages. Example: link to the Mesos Slave UI page displaying all scheduled containers
        Specified by:
        getJobLinks in interface IScheduler
        Returns:
        the links if any customized page. It returns an empty list if no any links

      • onKill

        public boolean onKill(com.twitter.heron.proto.scheduler.Scheduler.KillTopologyRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: IScheduler
        Called by SchedulerServer when it receives a http request to kill topology, while the http request body would be the protobuf Scheduler.KillTopologyRequest. The SchedulerServer would parse the request body and feed with this method. It would be invoked in the executors of SchedulerServer.
        Specified by:
        onKill in interface IScheduler
        Parameters:
        request - The KillTopologyRequest sent from local heron-cli
        Returns:
        true if the IScheduler kills the topology successfully. SchedulerServer would send KillTopologyResponse correspondingly according to this method's return value.

      • onRestart

        public boolean onRestart(com.twitter.heron.proto.scheduler.Scheduler.RestartTopologyRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: IScheduler
        Called by SchedulerServer when it receives a http request to restart topology, while the http request body would be the protobuf Scheduler.RestartTopologyRequest. The SchedulerServer would parse the request body and feed with this method. It would be invoked in the executors of SchedulerServer.
        Specified by:
        onRestart in interface IScheduler
        Parameters:
        request - The RestartTopologyRequest sent from local heron-cli
        Returns:
        true if the IScheduler restarts the topology successfully. SchedulerServer would send RestartTopologyResponse correspondingly according to this method's return value.

      • getTopologyConf

        protected java.lang.String[] getTopologyConf(PackingPlan packing)
        Build all the pod specifications so we can deploy the Heron topology. This will be a list of JSON strings that contain all the necessary pod specifications we'll need to pass to the K8S API
        Parameters:
        packing - - PackingPlan of the topology

      • buildKubernetesPodSpec

        protected java.lang.String buildKubernetesPodSpec(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper,
                                                  java.lang.Integer containerIndex,
                                                  Resource containerResource)
        Build a specification object for a K8S Pod, which will house the Docker image and necessary setup information about the Pod so we can run a Heron container
        Parameters:
        mapper - - ObjectMapper instance we can use to create new JSON nodes
        containerIndex - - The index of the container
        containerResource - - The Resource object for the new container

      • rebuildKubernetesPodSpec

        protected java.lang.String rebuildKubernetesPodSpec(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode podSpec,
                                                    com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper,
                                                    PackingPlan.ContainerPlan containerPlan,
                                                    java.lang.Integer oldContainerIndex)
        Build a new container spec based of an existing spec. This is used when we want to copy an existing spec so we can easily create a new one, while replacing necessary information like the container index
        Parameters:
        podSpec - - Existing pod specification JSON object
        mapper - - ObjectMapper instance we can use to create new JSON nodes
        containerPlan - - The ContainerPlan for the new container
        oldContainerIndex - - The index of the existing container

      • getMetadata

        protected com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode getMetadata(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper,
                                                                     int containerIndex)
        Build the metadata that we're going to attach to our Pod specification. This metadata will allow us to query the set of pods that belong to a certain topology so we can easily retrieve or delete all of them at once.
        Parameters:
        mapper - - ObjectMapper instance we can use to create other JSON nodes
        containerIndex - - Index of the container

      • rebuildContainerSpec

        protected com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode rebuildContainerSpec(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode existingSpec,
                                                                              com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper,
                                                                              PackingPlan.ContainerPlan containerPlan,
                                                                              int oldContainerIndex)
        Based on an existing container spec, rebuild it and replace necessary information for building a new container (primarily the container index)
        Parameters:
        existingSpec - - Existing container spec
        mapper - - ObjectMapper instance to use for creating new JSON nodes
        containerPlan - - New container's ContainerPlan
        oldContainerIndex - - The index of the old container

                                                                          int containerIndex,
                                                                          Resource containerResource)
        Get the JSON-based specification for the K8S Pod
        Parameters:
        mapper - - An ObjectMapper instance which can be used to create JSON nodes
        containerIndex - - Index of the container
        containerResource - - The containers Resource object

      • addContainers

        public void addContainers(java.util.Set<PackingPlan.ContainerPlan> containersToAdd)
        Add containers for a scale-up event from an update command
        Specified by:
        addContainers in interface IScalable
        Parameters:
        containersToAdd - the list of containers that need to be added NOTE: Due to the mechanics of Kubernetes pod creation, each container must be created on a one-by-one basis. If one container out of many containers to be deployed failed, it will leave the topology in a bad state. TODO (jrcrawfo) -- (https://github.com/twitter/heron/issues/1981)

      • removeContainers

        public void removeContainers(java.util.Set<PackingPlan.ContainerPlan> containersToRemove)
        Remove containers for a scale-down event from an update command
        Specified by:
        removeContainers in interface IScalable
        Parameters:
        containersToRemove - the list of containers that need to be removed NOTE: Due to the mechanics of Kubernetes pod removal, each container must be removed on a one-by-one basis. If one container out of many containers to be removed failed, it will leave the topology in a bad state. TODO (jrcrawfo) -- (https://github.com/twitter/heron/issues/1981)
